text:
Hi,

I'm trying to get a binary of xml-commons-resolver-1.1.jar into the maven
repository. First, I asked at maven-dev, and they told me to go to xml-commons
at apache, and get it uploaded at apache. Ibiblio then mirrors that, they say.

So, I joined commons-dev@xml.apache.org and wrote a message for that. There, I
was recommended to "ask the xml-commons folks" to do this for me. I hope I am
hitting the right place here now :-)

Here is link to the original request I made at maven:
  http://jira.codehaus.org/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=MAVENUPLOAD-80

it contains full info about what I request, where to get jar (i guess you guys
know that, though) and also comment log from maven folks about I should go to
you guys.

On commons-dev@xml.apache.org, Mark Diggory told me that:

>minotaur.apache.org:/www/www.apache.org/dist/java-repository is mirrored
>into www.ibiblio.org/maven.
creator: polesen@operamail.com
polesen@operamail.com
text:
Uhmm hi! Just wanted to know, if I hit the right place here with this bugreport?
Are there anyone to handle it?

creator: polesen@operamail.com
text:
Mark R. Diggory at the xml-commons-dev list helper me with the upload.
It is now at ibilio.
Nice!
